1389140.name: Jury Trial
1389140.description:
Interested in creating your own cases? With the ingame case editor you will be able to write your own cases and share them with the community. Whether fictional or recreated cases, the ingame editor got you covered.



In this law simulation RPG, you will tackle a multitude of different cases and champion the fight for justice. From representing the poorest of the poor and the wrongfully convicted to the wealthiest and most privileged members of society, you'll navigate through case materials, uncover inconsistencies to find new evidence, analyze and select jurors and experts, question witnesses, and strive to convince the jury at trial. Your clients depend on you because they have nowhere else to turn to.





  • Play the campaign or the single case files by downloading new cases created by the community from the Steam Workshop.
  • Create and upload your own cases using the ingame Case Editor
  • Search for evidence in a variety of different case materials
  • Question witnesses and jurors to find their specific traits and opinions
  • Choose the jury that fits your client
  • Try the case in the court of law
  • Solicit legal and illegal help to find the loophole or evidence that breaks the case





The game is set in a fictional country deeply divided by racial profiling, prejudice, and social injustice. A deep bias runs through the country and its people. Apart from your courtroom skills as a gifted negotiator, it’s crucial for you to find a jury that gives your client a chance Otherwise, every argument and scientific fact might be in vain because no one will listen.

Your potential jurors consist of:

  • Ten unique regions
  • Four ethnic groups
  • Six religions
  • Six political currents
  • Four levels of wealth and education
  • And six further defining traits out of a pool of over seventy traits



Jury Trial is a project by two indie developers who are doing their best to create a game in their spare time, one they've always wanted to play but couldn't find anywhere. Operating in a nearly nonexistent genre without a budget, we are driven by a passion for the world of law. If you have questions, suggestions, or are interested in offering your help as a potential tester or translator, please contact us through the Steam Community section or via social media.
